_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Trident Seafoods Anacortes processing facility uses anhydrous ammonia in excess of the threshold quantity and follows the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management requirements to train and protect persons working in the facility and living in our community.  Ammonia is used in a closed loop process to freeze finished frozen and breaded fish portions and other frozen portioned products.

Commitment to Safety

Trident's Anacortes facility has been accepted to participate in OSHAs' VPP program.  The program is "designed to develop and implement a system to identify, evaluate, prevent, and control occupational hazards to prevent employee injury."  Acceptance in the program is granted after an extensive evaluation of the facility and its' safety programs.  OSHA has awarded our facility VPP Star ranking, the highest ranking in their program.  Improvement to facility safety is fundamental to continuing participation in the program.  Anacortes is the second facility in our company to achieve this honor.  Our company goal is for all facilities to gain acceptance into the VPP program.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

The ammonia refrigeration system was designed to follow established Codes and Standards when it was built.  This insures safe design of the ammonia refrigeration system and its installation.  Following existing Building, Mechanical, Fire and Electrical Codes and Standards, the refrigeration systems' engineering design, materials of construction, procedures for proper installation of equipment by trained installation contractors, and testing piping and equipment safeties was performed on the system at installation.  Automatic devices protect against critical system upsets such as high levels, high pressures, and high temperatures.  There is a maintenance program at the facility used to document the testing, inspection, and maintenance of the refrigeration system and its components.  Training is provide

d and documented verifying operators are qualified to operate the system.  In addition, training is provided for emergency operation following written operating procedures.  An annual HAZWHOPER certification and refresher class is provided to key personnel in the facility.

The facility has an accidental release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. There is a Management System in place and the Plant Manager has overall responsibility for the program.  There is a person responsible for each of the listed elements of the program.  The Risk Management Prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?X    Employee Participation Program 

?X    Process Safety Information 

?X    Process Hazard Analysis 

?X    Operating Procedures 

?X    Training Program 

?X    Contractor Safety Program 

?X    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures 

?X    Mechanical Integrity Program 

?X    Hot Work Permit Procedures 

?X    Management of Change Procedures 

?X    Incident Investigation Procedures 

?X    Compliance Audit Procedures 

Five Year Accident History

There have been no ammonia related accidents in the last five years that have resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.

Description of Emergency Response Program

An emergency response program has been implemented at the facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures. The program has been coordinated with local fire department officials.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There are currently no changes identified to improve plant safety.
